title: Unclear issue with incremental compile

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Please contact me and I will give you access to my private repository on github if you are interesting in reproduction. The code isn't enormous, but it's unclear what is causing it. I also have some workarounds available so it is not urgent (this is a shallow justification for me not trying to prepare a smaller reproduction, I know, my apologies). Setting `CARGO_INCREMENTAL=0` fixes the issue for me. Deleting my target directory and rebuilding also fixes the issue. However, at revision 214ac8d, everything builds fine with `cargo build`. If I then remove 2 lines of dead code and `cargo build`, the panic occurs. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` PS C:\projects\chitin_stars> rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.60.0-nightly (1409c015b 2022-01-11) binary: rustc commit-hash: 1409c015b44a4d4d38bef2250b2a37c17b8b7463 commit-date: 2022-01-11 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.60.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 180 but the index is 180', compiler\rustc_query_impl\src\on_disk_cache.rs:726:18 ```
Backtrace

Note, the `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` produces an empty backtrace for me, here is the `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` ``` stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ffdc8df609f - ::fmt::h1cbc9437c25bbb3a 1: 0x7ffdc8e2510a - core::fmt::write::hba4814166b4d0ea8 2: 0x7ffdc8de7408 -
